Name: Statuette of Isis
Description: A bronze statuette of the goddess Isis, wife of Osiris, sitting on a throne, while nursing her son Horus. She is depicted with a solar disk over an uraeus crown. Her son wears a plait, symbol of infancy. This deity, one of the most popular among the Egyptian pantheon, was regarded as the mother goddess par excellence, and a model wife. She was worshipped all over Egypt.
